thread.title: Pen Argyl surges past Wilson for first football win of the season
thread.title_full: Pen Argyl surges past Wilson for first football win of the season

title: Pen Argyl surges past Wilson for first football win of the season
text:
Pen Argyl 49, Wilson 28 – Rapid Recap 
On a Homecoming day of record-setting performances at the Green Knights’ Alumni Stadium Saturday afternoon, Pen Argyl blew a close Colonial League game open with five consecutive unanswered touchdowns to take its first win of the season. Pen Argyl and Wilson are both now 1-7. 
Green Knight sophomore running back Logan Sterner tied a single-game Pen Argyl record by scoring five touchdowns on runs of 5, 6, 46, 73, and 28 yards. 
Wilson sophomore quarterback Cameron Clark set a single-game passing record with 349 yards, and his 93-yard TD pass to Job Goodman was the longest in school history. 
Turning point: Wilson had taken a 13-12 lead late in the second quarter after the hosts had led 12-0. On the next Pen Argyl possession, Sterner, on an option pass, found senior wide receiver James Klinger for a 61-yard touchdown pass that put the Green Knights ahead to stay, one of five straight Pen Argyl scores. 
Top performer: Logan Sterner ran for more yards and touchdowns Saturday (263 and 5) than he had all season (201 and 4.). His patient style of running baffled the Warriors. 
What it means: Pen Argyl won’t go winless and enters its final two games with a surge of momentum. Wilson did many things well enough to triumph, but must eliminate penalties and self-inflicted wounds to capture such winnable games. 
Brad Wilson may be reached at bwilson@lehighvalleylive.com . Follow him on Twitter @bradwsports . Find Lehigh Valley high school sports on Facebook .
